meanings.definition: A Korean martial art characterized by its emphasis on kicking techniques.
meanings.sent1: In taekwondo, students learn how to perform powerful kicks.
meanings.sent2: She has been practicing taekwondo for years and has mastered various kicking techniques.
meanings.sent3: Why did the kangaroo want to learn taekwondo? To improve its already impressive kicking skills!
meanings.sent4: Her determination in taekwondo was like a fierce kick that knocked down all obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The sound of a taekwondo kick echoed through the dojo, leaving everyone in awe of its strength.

meanings.definition: The sport of practicing and competing in taekwondo.
meanings.sent1: Taekwondo tournaments attract athletes from all over the world.
meanings.sent2: He won a gold medal in the national taekwondo competition.
meanings.sent3: The family picnic turned into a taekwondo match, with everyone trying to outkick each other!
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to taekwondo was like training for a never-ending championship.
meanings.sent5: The arena buzzed with excitement as the taekwondo competitors prepared for their matches.

meanings.sent1: The taekwondo instructor guided the students through their training.
meanings.sent2: She is a skilled taekwondo practitioner with years of experience.
meanings.sent3: The taekwondo enthusiast never missed a chance to show off their latest kick.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to taekwondo made him a respected member of the martial arts community.
meanings.sent5: The taekwondo student's passion for the art was evident in every move they made.
